Mount Victoria is on the Great Western Highway, about ten km after

, depending on which road you take, and the traffic conditions. You can reach Mount Victoria from the city by either the Great Western Highway, or by taking Bells Line of Road, then turning south at the Darling Causeway. Mount Victoria is also only fifteen minutes' drive from
Cityrail trains service Mount Victoria Station around every 1-2 hours on the
for more info. The station is on Station Street, from there it is a short uphill walk to the main shops and highway.
There are many lovely walks and climbs around the village with stunning views over the valleys. These can be accessed from Mount Piddington Road, Victoria Street and Grandview Street.

value: at the railway station displays equipment and artifacts from the very early settlement days of the region. The museum is open weekends, public holidays (except Christmas Day and Good Friday) and school holidays from 2PM - 5PM. +61 2 4787-1210.
is a movie cinema set in the old Public Hall along Harley Avenue. +61 2 4787-1577.

The village of Mount Victoria has several specialty gift and antique shops along Station Street and along the Great Western Highway.

value: has been operating for over twenty years and features a stellar collection of antique toys and collectibles. 86 Great Western Highway, just up the crest from the main village centre. +61 2 4787-1590.
Imperial Hotel, the oldest hotel in Australia

content=Is Australia's oldest tourist hotel and was founded in 1878. They have a comprehensive bistro which is open for lunch and dinner, seven nights a week. They feature live music weekends and host private functions, weddings and parties. The Imperial is at the corner of the Great Western Highway and Station Street. +61 2 4787-1878.
sits in the midst of the Station Street shopfronts, and is open for lunch or dinner. +61 2 4787-1275.
on Station Street features coffee, light meals such as croissants and is also a providore for deli-style cheeses, meats and local products. +61 2 4787-1157.
has a solid range of groceries and newspapers, and makes fresh in-house sushi as well as takeaway coffee. +61 2 4787-1231.

Additionally, the Caltex service station at the top of Victoria Pass is open 24/7 and has hot & cold meals and snacks.

value: has a comfortable bar and bistro with an outdoor garden featuring views to Mount Wilson. They also have a comprehensive bottle shop for takeaway. +61 2 4787-1878.

Mount Victoria has many guesthouses, private hotels and holiday accommodation:

value: content=Features double, family and spa cabins. Located juon Great Western Highway near the top of Victoria Pass. +61 2 4787-1256.
content=Is along Mount York Road and features ten luxurious rooms. It is a popular destination for wedding parties. +61 2 4787-1555.
is at the corner of Station Street and the Great Western Highway and features 26 rooms, from singles to family suites to a luxury period-decor spa suite. +61 2 4787-1878.
is on Station Street next to the Imperial Hotel and features all ground-floor self-contained units . +61 2 4787-1320.

content=Is one of the most prominent buildings in the region, and was built by J.R. Fairfax in the late 1870s. Today, it is a grand guesthouse featuring 13 ensuite rooms and three apartments. +61 2 4787-1369.
is classic Olde English style guesthouse featuring polls, spas and an a la carte restaurant. +61 2 4787-1241.

There are also a number of privately owned and operated guest cottages in the area.
The historic Jenolan Caves are only 55 km from the village, and the Mt. Tomah Botanical Gardens, the Scenic Railway and the ZigZag Railway are all within a short drive.
